summary: This bill, the "Securing Migration, Addressing Reform, and Talent Retention Act" (SMART Act), aims to overhaul the US immigration system. Key provisions include establishing a skills-based immigration points system, prioritizing spouses and minor children in family-sponsored immigration, eliminating the Diversity Visa Program, setting a limit on annual refugee admissions, and implementing H-1B visa reforms. It also introduces a "Gold-card" program for investors and new nonimmigrant classification for parents of adult US citizens with new conditions on admission.
